Give your students a famous story and have them rewrite a portion of the tale. You can do this with fairy tales, classic literature, or even pop fiction. It’s common for fiction writing classes to rewrite the endings of stories, but why stop there? Have your students change an event that occurs in the middle, or even in the very beginning. div.p: Writing Topics. Do you want to inspire your students to write great narratives, essays, and reports? Check out these grade-specific writing topics organized by mode (explanatory, creative, and so on).
